AUTOMOBILE SERVICE MANAGER

SUMMARY

Attentive Automobile Service Manager with comprehensive knowledge of the automobile industry. Adept at providing an
optimal level of customer support that includes speedy resolutions to customer service issues. Specialize in managing an
able staff to meet customer expectations.

EXPERIENCE


05/2013 to Current
Automobile Service Manager
Company Name
— City , State
Ensured that warranty specifications were upheld when work was performed Managed vehicle repair requests and regular service appointments Maintained inventory of replacement parts and prepared purchase orders Prepared shop displays of auto parts Inspected vehicle repairs Provided regular employee evaluations Ensured compliance with shop standards.

06/2011 to 05/2013
Automobile Service Manager
Company Name
— City , State
Clearly defined employee responsibilities and tracked performance.
Assisted with initial diagnostics and supervised vehicle work.
Ensured that customer and employee areas were kept clean and organized.
Managed service requests and prepared a database listing such requests.
Ensured timely completion of vehicle services.
Coordinated with sales team to prepare marketing strategies.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Industrial Program Manager

Location: Louisville, KY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
About Faurecia

Faurecia products and systems are in one out of three vehicles on the road today, including vehicles manufactured by the biggest and most well-known automotive brands in every region of the world.

Our comprehensive offer for SUSTAINABLE MOBILITY includes zero-emission hydrogen solutions, ultra-low emissions solutions, systems for advanced driver assistance and products made with a range of optimized and sustainable materials.

With our COCKPIT OF THE FUTURE, we create value for brands and connected experiences for consumers with our expertise in seating, interiors, lighting, body electronics, sensors, actuators and other display technologies and cockpit electronics.

But Faurecia is also so much more than a top-7 global automotive and technology leader. We inspire safer, more comfortable, more personalized and more sustainable mobility. We create advanced solutions to accelerate the transition towards CO 2 neutrality.

We believe people matter. We work on challenges that matter. If you join us, you’ll take a journey that matters.

 We’re hiring an Industrial Program Manager! 

Our Interior Systems Division is looking for an Industrial Program Manager for its manufacturing facility in Louisville, KY to have full ownership of all Industrial Development activities of the Program at the plant.

You’ll work on challenges that matter

This Job Will Require You To

 Responsible for the work packages execution for the Industrial Development of the Program at the Plant: industrial footprint, Plant equipment selection (new / reuse /share), Plant layout, MIFD /MIFA, industrial trials …  Responsible for the launch planning and budget from definition till execution  Participate in the development of Make or Buy strategy in accordance with Purchasing, Program and Plant(s) Starting from phase 3, be responsible for HSE and ergonomic convergence in the Plant  Define the Industrial Development support team required resources in terms of workload, competencies and profiles  Manage the Industrial Development support team to ensure Industrial Development and Plant launch readiness by conducting reviews, assigning tasks, driving accountability and preparing launch related staffing and training plans 


PROCESS DEVELOPMENT

 Approval of the following Process Development activities upstream: HSE and ergonomic convergence until GR2b 


PRODUCTION LAUNCH

 Management of launch activities at the Plant: Complete the Industrial Development support team with required resources (internal /external) in terms of workload, competencies and profiles  Liaise with UAPs and PC&Ls to plan production related runs / trials  Coordinate the installation and launch of production equipment and tooling  Support the production during the ramp-up after the handover 


TARGETS AND REPORTING

 Leadership for all Industrial Development Program objectives at the Plant: The IPM performance is evaluated based on Program Launch Report, Launch Cost and Status, respect of CAPEX, scrap rate, PPM, …  Ensure the Industrial Development milestones are passed successfully and on time 


HSE

 Support commitments established in the ISO 14001 Environmental Policy.  Ensure members in assigned area(s) of responsibility conform to relevant HSE requirements.  Support environmental programs to achieve objectives and targets. 


Other

 Follow values established within Being Faurecia.  Act with an entrepreneurial mindset as well as with autonomy and accountability.  Act in accordance with the behaviors as established in Faurecia’s Code of Ethics and Code of Management.  Commitment to the highest ethical standards and willingness to adhere to Faurecia’s Code of Ethics and Code of Management. 


Position Specifications

 Controls CAPEX spending for the plant  Perform machine changes as needed  Plant layout and MIFD updates  Accept and/or reject any potential plant equipment installation  Good financial skills (costing, budget, investment)  Leadership skills  Ability to interface with other functions - Networking capabilities.  International mindset 


 The ideal candidate 

To Succeed In This Position, You Will Ideally Have

 At least 5 years of experience in production area, including one position in Program Management  Preferably a Master’s degree in engineering or applicable work experience  Trained in Faurecia Excellence System and Program Management System  Experience in program launch  Proficient level of English 


Leadership Competencies

 Cultivates Innovation  Manage Ambiguity  Manage Complexity  Customer Focus  Drives Results  Being Resilient  Learning Agility  Political Savvy  Demonstrates Self-Awareness  Develops Talent 


 We believe people matter 

Faurecia is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

 Join us, and take a journey that matters

Experience Level (if available): None
<JD_END>
